Title: Specialist Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) will be home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP will offer rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe‚Äôs most attractive cities.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo ‚Äì Sete Rios, Av. Jos√© Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you‚Äôre part of something bigger, it‚Äôs because you are. At Amgen our shared mission‚Äîto serve patients‚Äîdrives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world‚Äôs leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together‚Äîresearching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It‚Äôs time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Specialist Artificial Intelligence Engineer

LIVE

What You Will Do

Amgen is seeking a Specialist IS Security Engineer who will report to the Senior Manager Global AI Security leader in our Cybersecurity and Digital Trust (CDT) organization and will be based in Lisbon Portugal, at Amgen‚Äôs Capability Center. At Amgen, our mission is simple: to serve patients. Our Capability Center provides essential services that enable us to better pursue this mission. This state-of-the art center serves as a base for finance, information systems, and human resources professionals to make a meaningful impact at one of the world‚Äôs leading biotechnology companies.

This position will join our cybersecurity team in securing the artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) systems that power innovation in Amgen. This role is essential in protecting sensitive biomedical data, safeguarding research models, and ensuring the trustworthiness of AI tools used in drug discovery, clinical development, and digital health.

The Security Engineer will work closely with cybersecurity architects, data scientists, bioinformaticians, and DevOps engineers to ensure our AI systems are designed, deployed, and maintained securely across cloud and on-prem environments. This is a senior technical role with influence across engineering, data science, and cybersecurity domains, will play a critical role in securing sensitive biomedical data, protecting proprietary models, and embedding resilience and compliance into our AI systems used in drug discovery, genomics, and digital health.

WIN

What We Expect Of You

Job Responsibilities:


Desing and implement secure-by-design AI/ML environments across cloud and on-premise platforms, ensuring robust access controls, encryption, and network segmentation.
Develop scripts and automation (Python, Bash) to implement security controls, monitor model integrity, and integrate vulnerability scanning and anomaly detection into AI workflows.
Conduct deep technical threat modeling and risk assessments focused on adversarial ML, data leakage, model manipulation, and supply chain vulnerabilities.
Support secure MLOPs development by building and maintaining secure MLOps frameworks (e.g., with Kubeflow, MLflow, or SageMaker) that support model reproducibility, traceability, and secure deployment.
Assist in securely implementing AI systems that comply with biotech and healthcare regulations including HIPAA, GDPR, 21 CFR Part 11, and GxP.
Develop and maintain security tooling and automation scripts to enhance visibility, vulnerability management, and model monitoring.
Perform security assessments and harden AI platforms, APIs, data repositories, and model endpoints.
Support engineering and implementation of tools for model explainability, bias detection, and auditability to meet regulatory and ethical AI requirements.
Help secure infrastructure and AI workloads in cloud platforms (AWS SageMaker, Terraform, Hashicorp, etc..) by managing IAM, encryption, and monitoring controls.
Partner with data science, R&D, and bioinformatics teams to ensure security is integrated into every stage of the AI lifecycle.
Participate in incident response efforts involving AI models or data pipelines, conducting root cause analysis and implementing remediation.
Continuously research emerging threats, tools, and best practices in AI security‚Äîparticularly those relevant to biotech applications.


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree and 6 years of Information Security or Information Technology experience
Or
Associate's degree and 8 years of Information Security or Information Technology experience
Or
High school diploma / GED and 10 years of Information Security or Information Technology experience


Preferred Qualifications


3-5+ years of experience designing, developing, or managing machine learning systems, with a strong understanding of AI pipelines.
Experience with secure MLOps and MLOPS lifecycle security tools (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, Whylabs)
Strong understanding of common software and web application security vulnerabilities. including OWASP top 10, SANS/CWE Top 25 etc
Hands-on experience implementing security for AI/ML systems used in clinical research, genomics, drug discovery, diagnostics, or digital health.
Demonstrated knowledge of adversarial machine learning techniques and defenses, including model evasion, poisoning, or inversion.
Understanding of HIPAA, 21 CFR Part 11, GxP, GDPR, and other regulations impacting AI use in healthcare and biotechnology.
Ability to incorporate threat intelligence into AI risk assessments and apply it to proactive model defensive engineering.
Familiarity with tools like SHAP, LIME, IBM AI Fairness 360, and Google‚Äôs What-If Tool to address AI model transparency and bias.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Title: Data Science Software Developer
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for a Data Science Software Developer to build high-quality tools, applications, and packages in R and Python that support scientific research, analytics, and business processes.

This role combines software engineering practices with a strong understanding of data workflows, aiming to create user-friendly, reliable, and validated software for internal teams.

Experience in the pharmaceutical or healthcare domain is a plus, especially with familiarity around clinical development standards and regulated environments.


Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.
It is a full remote role based in Portugal.
Starting date: October 2025


Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with statisticians, programmers, and data scientists to translate analytical and business needs into functional, scalable software tools and packages.
Design, develop, test, and maintain enterprise-grade applications and reusable packages using R, Python, and associated frameworks (e.g., Shiny, Dash).
Integrate applications with SQL/NoSQL databases and manage data access securely and efficiently.
Develop and document validated GxP-compliant tools, following Computer System Validation (CSV) processes and relevant regulatory frameworks.
Create user and technical documentation, and provide training or workshops as needed.
Track and manage development progress, issues, and enhancements using tools like GitHub or JIRA, applying Agile development practices.
Maintain tools post-deployment, releasing regular updates and responding to user feedback.
Contribute to innovation projects and provide subject matter expertise in internal product development and change initiatives.


Requirements For The Role


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong experience in R and Python programming, especially for building applications and reusable packages.
Proven ability in full-cycle software development:
Application architecture
Integration with databases
Code modularization and reuse
Version control (Git)
Testing and debugging
Deployment and scaling
Strong communication skills, with the ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience using GitHub or similar tools for source control and collaborative development.
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


Good To Have


Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, particularly in support of Shiny or web-based applications.
Applied experience in clinical development or biopharma environments.
Knowledge of CDISC standards and regulatory frameworks relevant to pharma.
Experience delivering validated tools in a GxP-regulated context.


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Data Modeller Scientist | Statistical Model Developer
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for a Data Science Modeller to develop robust, scalable models and transform them into production-ready solutions that support research, development, and business decision-making.

This role combines deep statistical expertise with strong engineering capabilities and a passion for delivering high-impact data science solutions.

You will collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to design, build, and deploy machine learning and statistical models in real-world environments.


Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.
It is a full remote role based in Portugal.
Starting date: October 2025


Key Responsibilities


Translate complex scientific or business problems into well-scoped modelling objectives and technical requirements in partnership with domain experts.
Develop end-to-end modelling pipelines, from data wrangling and preprocessing to model training, validation, and deployment.
Design and implement machine learning and statistical models‚Äîsupervised, unsupervised, and semi-supervised‚Äîwith a focus on transparency, robustness, and interpretability.
Deploy models into production environments using APIs, dashboards, web applications, or integrated components.
Validate models rigorously via cross-validation, sensitivity testing, and stress testing to ensure reliability.
Create comprehensive model documentation, including methodologies, assumptions, validation results, and user guidance.
Implement monitoring frameworks to track model performance, detect data drift, and trigger retraining workflows.
Apply MLOps and DevOps principles to automate deployment, versioning, and testing pipelines.
Utilise generative AI and large language models (LLMs) to enhance automation, documentation, or modelling capabilities.
Contribute to innovation initiatives and business transformation projects as a subject matter expert in modelling and AI.


Requirements For The Role


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent) in a quantitative discipline; postgraduate degree preferred.
Advanced proficiency in Python and R, including object-oriented programming, data science libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, tidyverse), and scripting for deployment.
Deep knowledge of statistical modelling, machine learning methods, and algorithm development.
Hands-on experience with DevOps and MLOps tools and practices (CI/CD, model monitoring, cloud-native deployment).
Familiarity with SQL and NoSQL databases and handling structured/unstructured data.
Experience with modern infrastructure and version control systems (e.g., Git, GitHub) for collaborative development.
Exposure to or experience using generative AI technologies (e.g., LLMs) in applied projects.
Experience in the pharmaceutical or healthcare domain is a strong advantage.
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Senior ML Engineer (Search & Personalization Team)
Description:
Department: Data Platform

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: Aleksandr Ageev

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 15 million users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

The company‚Äôs flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 40,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and SHEIN use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby generates over $10 billion in annual transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most-reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing FinTech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched in 2019 and has since raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors, and is now valued at $3.3 billion.

We are looking for a Senior ML Engineer to join our Search & Personalization team. While our team is responsible for building end-to-end ML solutions, your primary focus will be on the engineering side of the ML product lifecycle‚Äîensuring seamless CI/CD processes, scalable infrastructure, and robust productionization of ML models (both offline and online).

Our ML models power key marketplace features, including Search, All-Stores, and the main page of the marketplace. Our mission is to transform Tabby into more than just a BNPL platform‚Äîby connecting users with their aspirations.

Key Responsibilities


Own the engineering backbone of our ML lifecycle, ensuring reliable and scalable model deployment.
Develop and optimize Airflow DAGs for offline model training and inference.
Design and implement best practices for ML model registry, experiment tracking, and CI/CD pipelines.
Build and maintain robust monitoring for both offline jobs and online services.
Develop automated testing frameworks, covering data quality, integration, and load testing.
Collaborate with Applied Scientists to transition offline experiments into production-ready ML products.
Work closely with Backend Engineers to integrate ML models seamlessly into production systems.
Develop and optimize scalable Python services for model serving and data pipelines.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


3+ years of experience as an ML Engineer.
Strong proficiency in ML engineering tools, including:
W&B / ClearML / MLflow / DVC
GitLab CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow
FastAPI for serving ML models

Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (preferably GCP).
Deep understanding of ML system design best practices.
Familiarity with ML/DL Python stack: PyTorch, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Transformers, OpenAI APIs.
Solid experience in SQL and working with structured data.
English proficiency: B1+ (intermediate or higher).
Experience designing and scaling high-load Python services.
Background in automated testing (data quality, integration, load testing).
Experience with real-time ML model deployment and inference.
Knowledge of model optimization techniques: quantization, distillation, pruning.
Familiarity with Go or other backend programming languages.


Job Benefits

Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance



We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Causal Inference & Measurement (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Job Description

Join our team of data science and causal inference experts to shape next-generation pricing strategies and measure the causal impact of our initiatives. We employ state-of-the-art causal inference methods to understand and optimize pricing decisions for millions of customers. Our work not only drives efficient revenue management processes but also ensures that our strategies are grounded in robust, scientifically-valid findings.

YOUR ROLE AT SIXT


You design and build tools to measure the impact of pricing strategies using causal methods.
You apply techniques like A/B testing, difference-in-differences, and double machine learning to support business decisions.
You create and improve experiments to test pricing and marketing strategies in a structured way.
You develop and maintain tools that help estimate causal effects and work well in production systems.
You work with product managers, engineers, and data scientists to turn ideas into working solutions.
You stay up to date with research in causal inference and help guide and support less experienced team members.


Your Skills Matter


You have several years of experience in data science, especially working with causal inference and pricing or marketing data.
You have used causal methods to measure the effects of pricing strategies and revenue systems.
You are skilled in statistical analysis and familiar with methods like double machine learning, causal graphs, and propensity score matching.
You understand how to use tools like instrumental variables and synthetic controls to estimate effects in real-world data.
You have applied difference-in-differences and regression discontinuity designs to measure changes over time.
You can explain technical ideas clearly and work well with others to turn analysis into action.


What We Offer


Generous Time Off Enjoy 28 days of vacation, an additional day off for your birthday, and 1 volunteer day per year
Work-Life Balance & Flexibility Benefit from a hybrid working model, flexible working hours, and no dress code
Great Employee Benefits Access discounts on SIXT rent, share, ride, and SIXT+, along with partner discounts
Training & Development Participate in training programs, external conferences, and internal dev & tech talks designed for your personal growth and development
Health & Well-being Private health insurance to support your well-being
Additional Perks Enjoy the Coverflex advantage system to enhance your employee experience


Additional Information

About us:

We are a globally leading mobility service provider with a revenue of ‚Ç¨4.00 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (taxi, ride, and chauffeur services), and SIXT+ (car subscription), giving our customers access to our fleet of 350,000 vehicles, the services of 4,000 cooperation partners, and around 5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,000 rental stations. At SIXT, top-tier customer experience and outstanding customer service are our highest priorities. We believe in true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Get started with us and apply now!

About us:

We are a globally leading mobility service provider with a revenue of ‚Ç¨4.00 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (taxi, ride, and chauffeur services), and SIXT+ (car subscription), giving our customers access to our fleet of 350,000 vehicles, the services of 4,000 cooperation partners, and around 5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,000 rental stations. At SIXT, top-tier customer experience and outstanding customer service are our highest priorities. We believe in true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Get started with us and apply now!

Title: Lead AI Technologist
Description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We‚Äôve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.



Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.





Job Description



Role Overview



We are seeking a Lead AI Technologist to spearhead the design, implementation, and enablement of AI-powered solutions across Corporate IT. This role is central to our Intelligent Automation strategy, with a strong focus on using AI to streamline internal processes, automate tasks, and enhance employee productivity.



You will lead the technical roadmap for AI adoption, evaluate enterprise AI tools, and ensure all implementations align with our architecture, security, and business goals.



This is a hybrid role: remote work is possible, but occasional presence in the Lisbon office will be required for key meetings.



Key Responsibilities



Define and lead the technical roadmap for AI adoption within Corporate IT, aligned with the broader Intelligent Automation strategy.
Design and implement AI-driven solutions that automate business processes, reduce manual effort, and improve service delivery.
Act as the technical lead for enterprise AI tools such as Microsoft 365 Copilot, Microsoft Copilot Studio, and Azure OpenAI.
Lead the exploration and implementation of Agentic AI capabilities, including autonomous agents that can reason, plan, and execute multi-step tasks across enterprise systems.
Develop and optimize prompt engineering strategies to maximize the effectiveness of generative and agentic AI tools in real-world use cases.
Evaluate and recommend enterprise AI applications‚Äîincluding vendor solutions, internal prototypes, and platform-native tools‚Äîensuring they meet technical, security, and business requirements.
Collaborate with IT architecture, data, security, and business teams to ensure scalable, secure, and compliant AI implementations.
Contribute to AI governance frameworks, responsible AI practices, and internal policy development.


Qualifications







Proven experience designing and deploying AI/ML solutions in enterprise environments.
Strong understanding of GenAI, Agentic AI, LLMs, and generative AI technologies.
Hands-on experience with AI platforms (e.g., Azure OpenAI, Copilot Studio).
Familiarity with enterprise architecture, security, and compliance standards.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.


Additional Information



Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We‚Äôre a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us At Unit4, we offer:



‚Ä¢ a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful;

‚Ä¢ balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being;

‚Ä¢ talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry;

‚Ä¢ a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet;

‚Ä¢ a safe and inclusive working environment ‚Äì supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.



This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though ‚Äì we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!

Title: Fullstack Developer (XP)
Description:
You‚Äôll be focused in


Helping on all areas of software development, choosing the right technologies and frameworks for the problem in hand
Implementing new APIs from the ground up
Building front-end applications through appealing visual design
Contributing to tech and architecture decisions
Providing maintenance and optimize the existing code base always aware of SOLID principles and following Clean Code principles
Working with AWS and CI/CD pipelines.



In order to succeed, you‚Äôll need


Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
Proven experience working as a Fullstack Developer, working on the backend with object-oriented programming languages
Experience with Golang, Java or Kotlin
Experience in the conception and implementation of software solutions
Adaptability and openness to learn new object oriented languages
Strong interest in TDD and pair programming
Strong communication and analytical skills
Great English skills, both written and spoken.



Nice to have


Experience with TDD and tests in general
Experience with Pair Programming
Experience with Typescript and React.js



About The Team

The Fullstack Developer will have full coverage of the project lifecycle and will work collaboratively with all team members. VWDS is looking for experts that embrace all technology in both Front End and Back End and who are motivated by our ways of working: Extreme programming (always two developers working on the same task to ensure successfully live review), lean methodology and TDD.

Company Benefits


1200‚Ç¨ to equip your home office
720‚Ç¨ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)



Cool Things You‚Äôll Experience In Our Work Environment


Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding



About VWDS

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! üöó

Title: Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Pricing Optimization (m/f/d)
Description:
Join our team of data science and machine learning experts to shape next-generation pricing strategies. We combine cutting-edge techniques‚Äîlike price elasticity modeling, bid price strategies, and advanced ML‚Äîto optimize pricing decisions for millions of customers. Our work directly drives efficient revenue management processes and enhances the user experience.

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Operations Research with deep revenue management expertise and a solid background in mathematical optimization. Ideal candidates have hands-on experience in dynamic pricing, bid price optimization, and have worked in (or closely with) the airline or car rental industry.



YOUR ROLE AT SIXT


Revenue Management & Price Optimization Design, develop, and deploy advanced revenue management systems focusing on dynamic pricing and bid price optimization strategies.
Operations Research Modeling Formulate and solve complex optimization problems (linear, nonlinear, dynamic, stochastic) to maximize revenue and support key decision-making processes.
Demand Forecasting & Customer Willingness-to-Pay Create and refine forecasting models using time series and machine learning methods to capture customer demand and willingness-to-pay.
Algorithm & Tool Development Build and maintain robust algorithms that integrate seamlessly with production systems, ensuring efficiency and scalability.
Cross-Functional Collaboration Work closely with product managers, data engineers, and software developers to deploy end-to-end solutions and continuously improve analytical models.
Thought Leadership Stay current on the latest research in revenue management, operations research, and machine learning. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members.





YOUR SKILLS MATTER


Industry Experience 1+ yearin data science and operations research roles, ideally in car rental, airlines, or similar travel/hospitality sectors (plus).
Revenue Management Expertise Proven track record implementing or optimizing revenue management systems and pricing strategies.
Optimization & Solvers Strong background in mathematical optimization (linear, nonlinear, integer programming), solvers, and algorithm design (dynamic/stochastic programming).
Machine Learning & Forecasting Proficient in demand forecasting, time series modeling, and modern ML techniques (especially regression).
Programming Skills Expertise in Python for data analysis, modeling, and production deployment. Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Analytical Mindset Ability to translate complex business problems into actionable analytical tasks and clearly communicate findings to various audiences.
Pricing & Bid Price Optimization Practical experience designing or implementing bid price models in large-scale revenue management systems (plus).
Education Master‚Äôs degree (or higher) in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or a related quantitative field (plus).





WHAT WE OFFER


Generous Time Off Enjoy 28 days of vacation, an additional day off for your birthday, and 1 volunteer day per year
Work-Life Balance & Flexibility Benefit from a hybrid working model, flexible working hours, and no dress code
Great Employee Benefits Access discounts on SIXT rent, share, ride, and SIXT+, along with partner discounts
Training & Development Participate in training programs, external conferences, and internal dev & tech talks designed for your personal growth and development
Health & Well-being Private health insurance to support your well-being
Additional Perks Enjoy the Coverflex advantage system to enhance your employee experience





About us:

We are a globally leading mobility service provider with a revenue of ‚Ç¨4.00 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (taxi, ride, and chauffeur services), and SIXT+ (car subscription), giving our customers access to our fleet of 350,000 vehicles, the services of 4,000 cooperation partners, and around 5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,000 rental stations. At SIXT, top-tier customer experience and outstanding customer service are our highest priorities. We believe in true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Get started with us and apply now!

Title: Predictive Modeling Specialist
Description:
About Us



Indie Campers, the go-to campervan Marketplace, is on a mission of making road trips available to everyone. Thanks to its digital approach and customer-centric orientation, Indie Campers has developed a strong booking experience and high-quality road trips at affordable prices.

With over one million nights rented through our travel platform, we have welcomed more than 300,000 travelers from 169 countries. We offer a comprehensive and expanding array of road trip possibilities: short-term RV rentals, long-term campervan subscriptions, and the possibility of buying one of our vehicles available for sale.

Rooted in a deep technological focus, our challenges are both exciting and demanding and require top talent and motivation to be successfully pursued. We are growing our team and looking for those interested in pursuing this dream with us and joining an ever-developing journey.

THE ROLE

As Indie Campers' Predictive Modeling Specialist you will be in charge of creating and developing predictive models and algorithms to assist decision making, anticipate issues and detect opportunities.

You will report directly to the Own Fleet Director and work very closely with our Data, Product, Ecommerce, Pricing, Stock, Finance, and Marketing teams from our Lisbon, Portugal HQ.

WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?

You'll be responsible for creating and developing key capabilities that will make Indie Campers increasingly more data-driven.

The right candidate will:


Lead the creation and development of predictive models and algorithms.
Support forecasting and budgeting efforts with advanced analysis
Develop an E2E process of Models & Algorithms creation for Indie Campers.
Work constantly with model's end users to continously optimize them, making them increasingly more complete.
Oversee and detect which departments and areas could benefit more from the application of these tools in their activities.
Develop analysis tools to control and measure the impact of the predictive models and algorithms usage.
Together with Data, collect data, cleaning it, organising it, and search for customers behaviour patterns and what influences it.
Firslty focus on developing these capabilities for the Revenue department to then expand it company wide.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

You are fluent in English, spoken and written, with a Bachelor's or Master's in Finance, Mathematics, Engineering or Physics. You have minimum 4 years of professional experience, and previous involvement in algorithms and models creation or development.

Experience in working with large Datasets (SQL) and different data sources. Experience in using Python for scripting, data management and writing algorithms.

You'll lead the creation of tools and mechanism capable to automate decision making and improve our capability to react faster and plan ahead.

Are you ready to Go Indie?

Title: DATA ENGINEER - PYSPARK / PYTHON (HYBRID)
Description:
Portuguese company hires for hybrid work

Location: Lisbon, Portugal Candidates for this position must already be located in Portugal

Working Model: Hybrid - 60% Remote and 40% Presential

Language Requirements: Fluent Portuguese and english B2+

Seniority: 5+ years of experience

Sector: Energy

Instructions: Please send your CVs in English and make sure to include all skills and experience that match the requirements of the opportunity. This will significantly increase your chances of success.

We are looking Data Engineer to join our team. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will design, develop, and maintain robust data pipelines using PySpark and Python.You‚Äôll work with large-scale datasets, helping the organization transform raw data into actionable insights that drive real impact.


Your Role


We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines using PySpark and Python. You will handle large-scale datasets to empower data-driven decision-making across the company.

Your Main Responsibilities Will Include


Developing and optimizing data pipelines with PySpark.
Writing clean and efficient Python code to process, transform, and clean data.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand and deliver on data requirements.
Ensuring data accuracy, scalability, and reliability.
Your Profile / Must be clearly listed on your CV:


You are passionate about data engineering and enjoy creating simple, efficient, and scalable solutions.

We Are Looking For Someone Who Has


Strong expertise in PySpark and Python.
Proven experience working with large datasets.
Basic understanding of ETL and databases.
Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong teamwork and communication skills.

We are looking Data Engineer to join our team. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will design, develop, and maintain robust data pipelines using PySpark and Python.You‚Äôll work with large-scale datasets, helping the organization transform raw data into actionable insights that drive real impact.

  • Your Role

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines using PySpark and Python. You will handle large-scale datasets to empower data-driven decision-making across the company.

Your Main Responsibilities Will Include

  • Developing and optimizing data pipelines with PySpark.
  • Writing clean and efficient Python code to process, transform, and clean data.
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand and deliver on data requirements.
  • Ensuring data accuracy, scalability, and reliability.
  • Your Profile / Must be clearly listed on your CV:

You are passionate about data engineering and enjoy creating simple, efficient, and scalable solutions.

We Are Looking For Someone Who Has

  • Strong expertise in PySpark and Python.
  • Proven experience working with large datasets.
  • Basic understanding of ETL and databases.
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong teamwork and communication skills.

Title: Search Engine Evaluator - Portuguese (Portugal)
Description:
Overview:
Are you a web-savvy, search expert with a talent for finding things online by using just a few words? Do you want to influence the future of global AI search? If so, we want you on board!

Working on behalf of RWS, you will test and evaluate how our clients‚Äô search engine responds to everyday searches from everyday people.

Using your search expertise, you will work through a variety of assignments playing a crucial part in enhancing AI data which will be used to improve the online search engine experience of our clients‚Äô users.

You:


Inquisitive by nature with a real interest in AI
Have excellent skills in online research
Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
Continually maintain quality and accuracy SLAs
Have the self-discipline to stick to a schedule and get the work done despite the potential distractions of a home office
Be a critical thinker with ability to analyze information and assess its relevance or significance




Quick overview of the flexible, part-time job:

Language: English and Portuguese (Portugal) proficiency

Location: Portugal (Work from Home)

Schedule: E.g. 8-30 h/week. Avg. 15 h/weekly

Pay: Up to 8 EUR/hour

Who Should Apply: Ideal for freelancers, students, stay-at-home parents, or anyone seeking flexible remote work to improve AI models. No previous experience is required.

Role Description: Join RWS Group as an evaluator to enhance search engine results. Provide feedback on text, audio, images, and videos to refine AI data used by major search engines, social media sites, streaming platforms and more.

Requirements


Currently reside in Portugal
Strong understanding of popular culture in your locale (Portugal)
Commit to a minimum of 5 hours per week, maximum of 25 hours per week
Must sign and adhere to project NDA
Have a smartphone and personal computer with reliable internet connection
Reliable antivirus software to protect your computer as you surf the web
Must pass training modules and a required test created by our client before commencing work
Only one Search Quality Rater per household
Must be 18+ years old




Work Benefits


Flexible home-based work
Work-life balance
Potential side-hustle
Payments via PayPal/Bank Account
Access to more opportunities through our TrainAI Community




Apply now!

Title: Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Causal Inference & Measurement (m/f/d)
Description:
Join our team of data science and causal inference experts to shape next-generation pricing strategies and measure the causal impact of our initiatives. We employ state-of-the-art causal inference methods to understand and optimize pricing decisions for millions of customers. Our work not only drives efficient revenue management processes but also ensures that our strategies are grounded in robust, scientifically-valid findings.



YOUR ROLE AT SIXT


You design and build tools to measure the impact of pricing strategies using causal methods.
You apply techniques like A/B testing, difference-in-differences, and double machine learning to support business decisions.
You create and improve experiments to test pricing and marketing strategies in a structured way.
You develop and maintain tools that help estimate causal effects and work well in production systems.
You work with product managers, engineers, and data scientists to turn ideas into working solutions.
You stay up to date with research in causal inference and help guide and support less experienced team members.





YOUR SKILLS MATTER


You have several years of experience in data science, especially working with causal inference and pricing or marketing data.
You have used causal methods to measure the effects of pricing strategies and revenue systems.
You are skilled in statistical analysis and familiar with methods like double machine learning, causal graphs, and propensity score matching.
You understand how to use tools like instrumental variables and synthetic controls to estimate effects in real-world data.
You have applied difference-in-differences and regression discontinuity designs to measure changes over time.
You can explain technical ideas clearly and work well with others to turn analysis into action.





WHAT WE OFFER


Generous Time Off Enjoy 28 days of vacation, an additional day off for your birthday, and 1 volunteer day per year
Work-Life Balance & Flexibility Benefit from a hybrid working model, flexible working hours, and no dress code
Great Employee Benefits Access discounts on SIXT rent, share, ride, and SIXT+, along with partner discounts
Training & Development Participate in training programs, external conferences, and internal dev & tech talks designed for your personal growth and development
Health & Well-being Private health insurance to support your well-being
Additional Perks Enjoy the Coverflex advantage system to enhance your employee experience





About us:

We are a globally leading mobility service provider with a revenue of ‚Ç¨4.00 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (taxi, ride, and chauffeur services), and SIXT+ (car subscription), giving our customers access to our fleet of 350,000 vehicles, the services of 4,000 cooperation partners, and around 5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,000 rental stations. At SIXT, top-tier customer experience and outstanding customer service are our highest priorities. We believe in true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Get started with us and apply now!

Title: GenAI Developer
Description:
Talan ‚Äì Positive Innovation

Talan is an international consulting group specializing in innovation and business transformation through technology. With over 7,200 consultants in 21 countries and a turnover of ‚Ç¨850M, we are committed to delivering impactful, future-ready solutions.

Talan at a Glance

Headquartered in Paris and operating globally, Talan combines technology, innovation, and empowerment to deliver measurable results for our clients. Over the past 22 years, we‚Äôve built a strong presence in the IT and consulting landscape, and we‚Äôre on track to reach ‚Ç¨1 billion in revenue this year.

Our Core Areas of Expertise



Data & Technologies: We design and implement large-scale, end-to-end architecture and data solutions, including data integration, data science, visualization, Big Data, AI, and Generative AI.




Cloud & Application Services: We integrate leading platforms such as SAP, Salesforce, Oracle, Microsoft, AWS, and IBM Maximo, helping clients transition to the cloud and improve operational efficiency.




Management & Innovation Consulting: We lead business and digital transformation initiatives through project and change management best practices (PM, PMO, Agile, Scrum, Product Ownership), and support domains such as Supply Chain, Cybersecurity, and ESG/Low-Carbon strategies.






We work with major global clients across diverse sectors, including Transport & Logistics, Financial Services, Energy & Utilities, Retail, and Media & Telecommunications.

Job Description

About the Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Software Developer with strong experience in building VS Code extensions, integrating AI agents using tools like Langchain and LangGraph, and a passion for enhancing the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) through cutting-edge technologies.

You‚Äôll be part of a high-impact team, building tools that live where developers work from smart coding environments to agent-driven pipelines, and help shape the future of intelligent development.



What You‚Äôll Be Doing



Designing, developing, and publishing VS Code extensions.
Building and orchestrating Python-based AI agents with LangChain & LangGraph.
Creating intelligent prompts and workflows that optimize developer productivity.
Using tools like GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Windsurf, and similar for vibe-driven coding experiences.
Proposing and developing novel use cases for AI in the SDLC.
Delivering production-ready artifacts.
Operating in private (OpenShift) and public cloud environments (AWS).
Working collaboratively in an Agile team, proposing architectural and process improvements.







Qualifications

Requirements



Proven experience building VS Code extensions (TypeScript/Node.js).
Strong Python skills; hands-on experience with LangChain, LangGraph, or similar agentic frameworks.
Knowledge of MCP servers and their integration within VS Code and AI toolchains.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures: embeddings, similarity search, and LLM models.
Experience using AI-powered development tools such as GitHub Copilot, Cursor, and Windsurf.
Comfortable deploying and maintaining solutions in both OpenShift (private cloud) and AWS (public cloud).
Skilled in crafting and refining prompts to maximize AI agent performance
Solid grasp of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), with an eye for AI-enhanced improvements across stages.





Nice to Have



Experience with developer productivity tooling.
Contributions to open-source extensions or AI/agent frameworks.
Background in DevOps, CI/CD, or MLOps.



Additional Information

What do we offer you?



Full-time contract.
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development.
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance.
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects.
This is a hybrid position based in M√°laga, Spain. Relocation is mandatory.
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!



Talan Spain‚Äôs commitment to non-discrimination based on gender, race, ideology, or any other reason, in accordance with the company‚Äôs "Equality Plan" and the current regulations on gender equality between women and men (Royal Decree-Law 6/2019).

Title: Researcher
Description:
About Symbiotic

At Symbiotic, we are building a permissionless shared security primitive that empowers network builders to shape and personalise their unique restaking implementation. Our goal is to minimise risks while maximising freedom for all you wonderful builders of crypto infrastructure networks. We have a robust developer-centric proposition and we can't wait to share it with everyone.

You can find more information about what we're building and how we're doing it in our docs.

Our People

We're a tight-knit team of experienced individuals at the forefront of crypto infrastructure. Our backgrounds range from security auditing and smart contract development to node operation, and we're supported by Paradigm and CyberFund.

We're on the hunt for talented professionals to join our mission and strengthen our awesome team.

The Role

We are looking for a motivated Researcher with a strong interest in Web3 technologies to join our team. In this role, you will dive into researching various Web3 projects and emerging trends, helping us identify collaboration opportunities and innovative solutions. This position is ideal for someone with a math, physics or CS background who is analytical, proactive, and eager to learn about blockchain, cryptocurrencies, and decentralized applications.

What you'll do


Conduct research on various Web3 projects ‚Äì gathering, organising and analysing information.
Read and analyse relevant blogs, white-papers, and technical documentation on Web3 topics.
Research potential partners and identify opportunities for collaboration.
Prepare summaries, brief reports and blogs on projects and emerging Web3 trends.
Generate ideas and out-of-the-box solutions for integrating Web3 projects.


Who you are


Analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to dive deep into new topics.
Ability to find relevant information and structure it effectively.
Basic understanding of Web3 fundamentals (blockchain, cryptocurrencies, decentralized applications), not necessarily in-depth, but a strong willingness to learn.
Proficiency in English (reading and writing) for analysing information and writing reports.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently in an uncertain environment.
Prior experience in research, analytical writing, or data analysis is a plus.
Ability to read and understand basic smart contract code (Solidity preferred) or a willingness to learn it.
Understanding of security risks in blockchain (e.g., reentrancy attacks, rug pulls, common vulnerabilities in smart contracts).

Title: Santander Young Talent Program Portugal
Description:
Country: Portugal

Santander Young Talent Program Portugal

Are you ready to take the next step in your career and be part of the digital revolution in the banking sector? Join our Santander Young Talent Program Portugal.

This program is designed for early workers with an engineering, design, data and business background, with a high level of English and a great curiosity for new ways of working and transformation, looking to develop their skills and knowledge in a dynamic and global environment.

In addition to working with us full-time, you will receive specialized training through a tailor-made program.

What do we have for you?

Professional Growth: You will participate in innovative and strategic projects that will allow you to gain practical experience and develop your skills in the banking sector.

Training: Learn from the best. You will have the support of mentors and access to a development experience to enhance your business and soft skills.

Impact: Contribute to the digital transformation of Banco Santander and the revolution of the financial sector.

Your role

As part of the Santander Young Talent Program, you will be a key driver of innovation, developing solutions that make a difference in the financial sector.

What you will do:

Data Analysis: Use advanced tools to identify market trends and evaluate the gaps.

Market Research: Conduct studies to better understand our customers and analyze competitor strategies.

Digital adoption: Participate in the development of digital tools and solutions, ensuring they improve our customer experience,

Project Management: Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure projects are completed on time and meet established objectives.

Optimization: Analyze core processes and products performance and propose improvements to optimize the customers‚Äôand employees‚Äô experience.

Requirements:

Masters Degree: Engineering, finance, business, data, design, gaming, AI or related fields.

English Level: High (C1 or higher).

Skills: Analytical ability, critical thinking, communication, and teamwork.

Interest: Passion for learning, curiosity, and energy to transform the world around us.

Benefits:

Competitive Salary: Attractive and competitive compensation designed to recognize and reward your talent and dedication.

Growth Opportunities: Possibility of development and promotion within the organization.

Work Environment: Collaborative and multicultural environment.

Title: Data Curation Developer - R&D
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for a Data Curation Developer to help transform raw scientific data into high-quality, analysis-ready datasets. In this role, you will support research and development (R&D) initiatives by ensuring data privacy compliance, unifying diverse data sources, and enabling seamless integration into analytical platforms.


Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.
It is a full remote role based in Portugal.
Starting date: October 2025


Key Responsibilities


Perform data curation tasks such as preprocessing, contextualization, and anonymisation to ensure datasets meet privacy standards and are ready for analysis.
Process datasets according to approved data reuse requests, ensuring compliance with regional data regulations (e.g., excluding subjects from restricted countries).
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code with strong quality controls.
Integrate various data sources, including clinical trials, real-world data, and omics, into standardised formats to support consistent and scalable analysis.
Provide peer reviews and coaching to uphold best practices in data curation and privacy.
Collaborate with R&D and data platform teams to define and develop business requirements for data curation activities.
Maintain close relationships with analytics and platform engineering teams to ensure data accessibility and usability.


Requirements For The Role


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in a relevant field.
Experience in complex batch processing, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Airflow, Delta Lake, PySpark, Pandas, and other Python dataframe libraries
Experience curating and processing large-scale datasets while maintaining strict data privacy and security standards.
Strong background in working with structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.
Understanding of data governance, especially related to anonymisation and compliance.
Strong communication skills to effectively present curated datasets and insights.
Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into scalable, technical data workflows.
Experience quantifying the business impact and value of data curation activities.
Experience in R is a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Data Curator
Description:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies

Dealroom is the world‚Äôs startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world‚Äôs next generation of transformative companies.

We‚Äôre on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.

About The Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.

As a Data Curator, you‚Äôll


Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.


What You Bring


Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.


What We Bring To The Deal


Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we‚Äôll support your growth.
Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy benefits like a laptop of your choice, flexible hours, a fully equipped home office setup, travel allowances, a development budget, weekly workout sessions, and more.
Global & Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse team spanning over 25 nationalities.
Vibrant Workplace: Work in a dynamic environment in the heart of Lisbon (Baixa-Chiado) with flexible hybrid options.
Meritocratic Environment: We value entrepreneurial thinking and are committed to turning innovative ideas into reality.


Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let‚Äôs create something transformative together.
