Title: Python Developer (FastAPI or Flask)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.




We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.




With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

Are you ready to shape the future with one of the world‚Äôs leading technology giants? We are looking for a Python Developer (FastAPI or Flask) to integrate a global powerhouse - the forefront of digital transformation, engineering solutions that redefine industries, improve lives, and create a sustainable tomorrow.




#Oporto (hybrid).




What you will do:

In this role as a Python Developer, you will engage directly with business stakeholders to understand their challenges and provide innovative solutions tailored to their needs. Your work will involve designing and implementing applications that support business objectives in an agile environment, ensuring scalability and efficiency.

As part of an international team, you will be responsible for maintaining and enhancing company' corporate platforms by developing new functionalities and improving existing ones. Your role will cover the entire software development lifecycle, including specification, design, implementation, testing, and bug fixes.




Here, we don‚Äôt just embrace innovation ‚Äì we drive it!




What you are like:

3+ Years of work experience with Python Backend Development;
Experience with developing web API frameworks (FastAPI or Flask);
Knowledgeable on writing unit tests (Pytest);
Experience working with graph databases such as Neo4J or similar technologies;
Good experience of working with CI/CD pipelines with Gitlab for automated deployments
Comfortable with the english language (mandatory).




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
‚Ä¶ and much more!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Python Developer

Seniority: Mid-s√©nior




The amazing you, will have:

Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar;
Minimum 3 years of professional experience as a python Developer;
Solid knowledge of Python, FastAPI, Sphinx, Helm, GitHub, Azure cloud resources, Docker
Fluency in the English language (mandatory) and portuguese;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto or Lisbon (Portugal);










Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Your responsibilities




We‚Äôre looking for a Python Developer (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust back-end services to join our team and contribute to the development of our web-based product: the AI-powered CELUS Engineering Platform, which automates the electronics engineering process and significantly reduces development time. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development and a commitment to seamless user experiences. In this role you will:




Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
Interact with a wide variety of tasks, from building APIs to coming up with clever business logic.
Interface and team up with other areas of engineering to solve diverse back-end problems, from third-party integrations to data modelling.




Your profile




3+ years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, preferably FastAPI, pydantic
Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB and SQL preferred
Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
Knowledge of micro-service architecture is highly advantageous but not essential
Fluent in written and spoken English
Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking
Fluent in written and spoken English




We offer:

Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.




Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.




Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.




Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.




Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, English/Portuguese language classes, trainings and workshops.




Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, ‚Äúworkation‚Äù program, 24 vacation days plus additional paid Christmas week holiday.

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Professionals With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Information Technology or Computer Engineering or related field;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with Python development;
  • Previous experience with SQL and relational databases;
  • Experience in REST APIs and synchronous messaging;
  • Experience in Docker (from the developer's point of view);
  • Experience in Git;
  • Knowledge of microservices design patterns;
  • Knowledge of CI/CD;
  • Previous contact with unit, integration and end-to-end testing;
  • Organizational and communication skills;
  • Proactivity and dynamism;
  • Good English level.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Start your exciting journey with Aubay right here

Aubay Portugal is a subsidiary of the multinational French company, Aubay Group, present in Portugal since 2007. With offices in Lisbon and Porto, we are a leading provider of consulting services, specializing in the management, implementation, development, and maintenance of information systems.

Our expertise spans a wide range of industries, including banking, insurance, telecommunications, energy, transportation, and services, where we collaborate with over 150 active partners to deliver innovative, tailored solutions.

At Aubay, we‚Äôre committed to empowering businesses through digital transformation, offering cutting-edge technology and deep industry knowledge to drive success.

What are you going to do

Develop and maintain software solutions using Python with a focus on clean, efficient code.
Create and manage automation scripts within Linux environments.
Utilize other scripting languages, especially Shell scripts, to support system and application tasks.
Use version control systems to manage codebase changes and collaborate with the development team.

What are we looking for

At least 6 years of solid experience in Python programming and development.
Strong background in scripting for Linux operating systems.
Proficiency with other scripting languages, particularly Shell scripting.
Experience using version control tools, with a preference for Git.

What do we offer you?

At Aubay, we believe in creating an environment where both your career and well-being thrive. Here's what you can expect when you join us:

Health Insurance: Your health and well-being are a priority.
Feedback&Coffee: A unique system that integrates Aubay's Performance Management Cycle with regular feedback sessions and a Career Progression Model, designed to foster your growth and success.
Working Model: Hybrid model with office in Porto/Braga.
A Tailored Training Academy: We‚Äôre dedicated to your professional development with both technical and behavioral training. From e-Learning and classroom sessions to Meet&Techs, Webinars, and Mentoring, we provide a variety of learning opportunities to suit your needs.
Exciting Events & Teambuilding: Enjoy a vibrant company culture through regular events and team-building activities that strengthen relationships and enhance collaboration.

What makes us different?

At Aubay, we foster a unique environment where people come first. Here‚Äôs what makes us different:

A Culture Built on Core Values: Our organizational culture thrives on transparency, team spirit, regular feedback, and continuous learning ‚Äî all designed to support your personal and professional growth.
Recognition & Rewards: Enjoy reference prizes and a birthday gift as a token of appreciation for being part of our team.
Freedom in Expression: We embrace a casual dress code, allowing you to feel comfortable and authentic at work.
A Friendly and Inclusive Atmosphere: At Aubay, we know your name, and we communicate informally ‚Äî fostering a relaxed, close-knit environment.
Grow with Us: You will grow alongside inspiring colleagues who support and challenge you. Isn't this the best way to develop professionally?

If we‚Äôve sparked your interest, we‚Äôre now ready to ignite your enthusiasm. Are you ready for the first step?

We are waiting for you at maria.t.moreno@aubay.pt!

Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract; Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for one year period). The collected data might be transferred or include other processing actitivites, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law. For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL‚Äôs headquarters in Avenida Duque D`√Åvila, n¬∫46 em Lisboa or use the DPO‚Äôs e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority ‚Äì www.cnpd.pt. (please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.)

Title: Data Scientist - Gen AI Engineer
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
Data Scientist - Gen AI Engineer (Lisbon/Porto)

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

YOUR ROLE

Develop, fine-tune, and deploy Generative AI models using AWS services like Bedrock, SageMaker, and Lambda.

Work with LLMs, embeddings, transformers, and diffusion models for applications in NLP, image generation, and AI automation.

Optimize prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) techniques.

Build scalable MLOps pipelines for training and deploying GenAI models using SageMaker, ECS, and Kubernetes.

Process and manage large-scale datasets for AI training using AWS Glue, Athena, and Redshift.

Implement vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS, Amazon OpenSearch) for efficient retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) applications.

Design and optimize ETL pipelines for AI/ML data workflows.

Collaborate with software engineers, DevOps, and product teams to integrate AI models into applications and APIs.

Ensure security, compliance, and data privacy in AI/ML workflows.

Monitor AI model performance and retraining needs using AWS CloudWatch, MLFlow, and other observability tools.

YOUR PROFILE

Strong background in Data Science, Machine Learning, and Generative AI.

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers).

Experience with AWS AI/ML services such as SageMaker, Bedrock, Lambda, and Comprehend.

Hands-on experience with LLMs, embeddings, transformers, and diffusion models.

Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), vector databases, and knowledge graphs.

Experience in MLOps, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS), and CI/CD for ML pipelines.

Solid understanding of cloud optimization, distributed computing, and model scaling.

Strong data engineering skills for processing large datasets in AWS Glue, Athena, or Spark.

Knowledge of NLP, image generation models, or multimodal AI solutions.

Nice To Have

Experience with fine-tuning open-source models (LLaMA, Falcon, Mistral, Stable Diffusion).

AWS certifications such as AWS Certified Machine Learning ‚Äì Specialty.

Experience with real-time AI applications, chatbot development, or autonomous agents.

Knowledge of ethical AI, bias mitigation, and AI safety best practices.

What You'll Love About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Training and certifications programs.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.


About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
At Axians, we value talent, not labels.

We believe in a culture of inclusion, where everyone has a place and all applications are considered based on merit, without discrimination.

This is your opportunity to join an international group with a project that needs you to help meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to perform duties as a Python Developer for a national project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Code and test software components and parts assigned to them for the technical domains under their responsibility in compliance with development and security norms and standards.
Help in the design, model and implementation of the product‚Äôs solution, as necessary, with the objective of optimize the quality of the code and its future maintainability.
Participate in the delivery of the product components in the different environments, in close collaboration with other teams whenever necessary.
Act as a reference in the function and capitalize on the gathered experience to share knowledge, train and coach others.


üí° What We're Looking For


Proficiency in Python Programming;
Proven experience with Flask / Fast API;
Experience with SQL;
Experience in Front-End programming is valued (Javascript / Angular);
Fluency in English (written & spoken).


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject ‚ÄúPD/AS/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
üåü Opportunity : Chapter Lead Data Scientist

Our client is a global leader and fast-growing data science powerhouse committed to excellence in transforming complex data into actionable insights. With a diverse team of experts from around the world, they strive to be the foremost partner in advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and digital transformation, empowering organizations to achieve breakthrough performance and a competitive edge.

üöÄ Responsibilities :


Contribute to shaping the Data Science department and technical vision.
Maintain an overview of the full Data Science project portfolio, identifying opportunities to connect technical efforts and ensure consistency in quality and methodologies.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders and sales teams to align technical solutions with client needs.
Mentor and coach team members, promoting best practices in code quality, model development, and lifecycle management.
Lead internal initiatives focused on knowledge sharing, technical excellence, and team cohesion.
Support the career development of more junior team members.
Oversee CI/CD processes for deployed solutions and participate in code and algorithm reviews.


üë§ Profile sought :

Education :

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field.

Technical Skills :


3+ years of experience in Python, Data Science, and Machine Learning, with at least 1 year in a technical leadership role.
Proven track record of ownership across the full Data Science lifecycle: from conceptualization to implementation and stakeholder communication.
Solid theoretical foundation combined with strong implementation skills.

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Python Developer to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

You Must Have

  • Between 6-9 years of experience working in a similar role;
  • Strong proficiency in Pure Python;
  • Good understanding of Python libraries (Pandas);
  • Experience with SSAS and SSRS;
  • Power BI is a plus;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders;
  • Good level of English (B2).

What can you expect from us?

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Python Developer!




Responsabilities:

Code and test software components and parts assigned to them for the technical domains under their responsibility in compliance with development and security norms and standards.
Help in the design, model and implementation of the product‚Äôs solution, as necessary, with the objective of optimize the quality of the code and its future maintainability.
Participate in the delivery of the product components in the different environments, in close collaboration with other teams whenever necessary.
Act as a reference in the function and capitalize on the gathered experience to share knowledge, train and coach others.




Requirements:

Experience with Python Programming.
Experience with Flask / Fast API.
Experience with SQL.
Experience with Javascript.
Experience with Angular.
Experience with Knowledge of Java.
Ability to collaborate / Teamwork.
Attention to detail/rigor.
Ability to synthetize / simplify.
Proactivity.
Critical Thinking
Good level of English.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/Python".




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Scientist (Mid-Senior)
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
Your Role

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in contributing to the development and implementation of AI models and algorithms to address complex business challenges. Your key responsibilities will include:


Taking ownership of data science initiatives and projects, demonstrating a proactive and results-driven approach.
Analyzing and interpreting complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and providing data-driven recommendations.
Collaborating seamlessly with multidisciplinary teams to comprehend business needs, designing, and implementing statistical models and machine learning algorithms.
Leveraging big data technologies and distributed computing frameworks for processing and analyzing large volumes of data, or equivalent cloud computing expertise.
Developing and deploying predictive models and algorithms in real-world production environments.
Conducting comprehensive exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and model validation.
Effectively communicating finding and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Embracing a data-driven, solution-oriented, and critical mindset, fostering teamwork and collaboration.


Your Profile


2 or more years of experience in data science roles with a focus on statistical modeling, machine learning, and predictive analytics.
Proficiency in programming languages, including SQL, Python, and distributed/cloud processing framework such as Pyspark.
Exhibit familiarity with advanced analytics libraries/frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, Scikit-learn.
Robust understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and various machine learning techniques.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and libraries such as Seaborn, Matplotlib, or Plotly.
Proven ability to work with large datasets and experience in distributed computing frameworks, either on-premises or in the cloud.
Excellent communication skills, enabling effective collaboration within cross-functional teams.
Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and strong problem-solving skills for addressing complex data challenges.
Hold a solid academic foundation in a relevant discipline, such as Engineering, Data & AI, or Computer Sciences.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, GCP, AWS is a plus)
Mandatory fluency in English.


What You'll Love You About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment;
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance;
Engage in exciting national and international projects;
Hybrid work;
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities;
Training and certifications programs;
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations;
Great office locations.


About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Computer Vision
Description:
We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist who is not only technically proficient but also a proven leader and innovator. You will be instrumental in driving our data science initiatives forward, ensuring all our work adheres to the highest standards of the medical device industry. This is an opportunity to make a significant and immediate impact. We are looking for a candidate with a robust background and a passion for data science, particularly within the medical field.




Qualifications




You have a PhD or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
You can effectively translate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You have proven leadership experience with a track record of successfully delivering complex projects.
You have extensive hands-on experience with image models and relevant deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
You have deep expertise in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services relevant to data science, including Vertex AI, AI Platform, Cloud Storage, Compute Engine, Dataflow, and BigQuery for large-scale data warehousing and analytics.
You have a strong understanding of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles and experience working with MLOps pipelines.
You have solid experience navigating data compliance challenges within the medical field and with medical devices. This includes familiarity with regulations like HIPAA, GDPR standards, and an understanding of the unique data challenges and ethical considerations inherent in this critical industry.







Key Responsibilities




Leading the design, development, and deployment of machine learning models specifically for medical device applications.
Guiding the team in selecting appropriate methodologies, algorithms, and tools for diverse data science problems.
Ensuring the scalability, robustness, and maintainability of data science solutions in a production environment.
Overseeing and architecting the entire data lifecycle, from ingestion and transformation to storage and access, while ensuring data quality and availability.
Spearheading data compliance efforts within the data science team, ensuring strict adherence to regulations pertinent to the medical field and medical devices (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, FDA regulations, ISO 13485, MDR/IVDR, and the Data Act).
Collaborating closely with legal, regulatory, product and quality assurance teams to ensure all data science initiatives meet the highest compliance standards.
Providing technical guidance and mentorship to junior and mid-level data scientists, fostering their growth and skill development.
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative spirit.
Contributing to the strategic direction of the data science team, aligning data initiatives with broader business objectives.




Show more

Title: Development Engineer
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîé We are looking for a Development Engineer (analysis, programming) ETL/ BI.







MAIN TASKS:

Monitor and manage run processes in non-production environments (testing and homologation).
Develop and maintain ETL processes using Semarchy.
Participate in non-production support activities, including troubleshooting and debugging issues.
Ensure rigorous documentation and adherence to best practices in data engineering.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Proficiency in French (C1 level mandatory).
At least 2 years of experience in data engineering.
Strong knowledge of Oracle SQL, VTOM (or ControlM), Unix, and SQLLoader for table loading.
Experience with ETL tools, particularly Semarchy.
Background and education in computer engineering or a related field.
Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with application production teams.
A curious and rigorous mindset with a passion for learning and problem-solving.




üìçHybrid role in Porto.







üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Python Backend
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Python Backend

Seniority: Senior (5+ years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Lisbon. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


Minimum of 4 to 5 years of proven experience as a Backend Developer.
Strong knowledge of Python for backend development.
Experience with frameworks such as Django and/or FastAPI.
Solid knowledge of relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and non-relational databases (e.g., MongoDB).
Experience with RESTful APIs and good API design practices.
Proficiency with version control systems (Git).
Fluent English (spoken and written) ‚Äì used daily in the work environment.

Title: Desenvolvedor Python
Description:
At ALTEN, we are certain that the success of our projects is due to the people who make up our team. That‚Äôs why, if you have at least 3 years of experience as a Python Developer we are committed to boosting your talent, meeting your professional expectations, and making you feel right at home. Do you want to build the world of tomorrow today? Keep reading!




Job Description and Main Tasks:

Primary goal will be to continually improve the core framework used for data integration and calculation of Market and Counterparty Risk Metrics.
Innovation is a key element of Risk Systems, so candidates will have the opportunity to collaborate in cross-team innovative projects and propose initiatives aligned with our top innovation priorities
Develop and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications
Ensure code documentation and organization
Incrementally deliver applications to meet dynamic customer requirements
Resolve incidents in a production environment
Collaborate with different stakeholders in the solution of problems and blockages




Skills:




Python
Experience with SQL and any industry standard relational database
Demonstrable ability to write clean and readable code
Solid understanding of both object-oriented and functional programming paradigms
Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
Advanced English







What can we offer you?

Joining a competitive, multinational company that is constantly growing.
Integration into a highly qualified team of professionals with a great work environment‚Äîinnovative and dynamic.
Specialized training and ongoing professional development.
Social benefits.
Competitive salary.




Who are we?

We are a team. We are part of ALTEN, a European multinational specializing in providing consulting, information technology, and engineering services to the leading companies in the Portuguese market.

If you like numbers, we can tell you that in Portugal we have 2 headquarters, and a team of 2.500 professionals.

Moreover, at ALTEN, we take pride in offering equal opportunities regardless of gender, age, abilities, or country of origin. Our commitment is to talent and to the people who possess it.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
Ready to make a positive difference in healthcare? My client is a well-funded start-up at the forefront of medical device technology. They are looking to hire a Data Scientist to join their top-tier data science team in Porto (UPTEC Asprela).




They have patented diagnostic technology already making a difference to patients, and FDA approval is on the horizon. There has never been a better time to join their elite team of physicians, software engineers, and data scientists!




This is what your day to day will look like:

Leading the design, development, and deployment of machine learning models specifically for medical device applications
Translating complex technical concepts to internal and external stakeholders
Championing data compliance efforts (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, FDA regulations, ISO 13485, MDR/IVDR, and the Data Act)
Guiding the team in selecting appropriate methodologies, algorithms, and tools for diverse data science problems
Driving data science initiatives forward
Supporting the mission to revolutionize healthcare




If you have these technical skills, you will be a great fit:

Expertise in Google Cloud - Vertex AI, AI Platform, Cloud Storage, Dataflow
PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Biomedical Engineering or a similar field
Deep learning frameworks - TensorFlow and PyTorch
Infrastructure as code principles
Hands-on experience with MLOps pipelines and tools




Technical expertise aside, we are looking for you to be objective-focused. You will react well to rapidly changing priorities whilst never losing sight of the bigger picture.




You will take pride in ownership and delivery of complex projects. We are hiring for the long term, so growth to a Lead role is on the roadmap. Come and embrace the future with us!




Interested in finding out more?

This is a senior, permanent hire and the salary range is ‚Ç¨55,000 - ‚Ç¨65,000 p.a. + life assurance, pension, and future stock options. Remote or Hybrid to Porto offices can be discussed at interview.




Atomic Talent is the agency exclusively handling this position, and we are happy to speak about this opportunity in the first instance via email (tom@atomic-talent.com) or here on LinkedIn. We respond to everyone, so please apply even if you feel that you only hit 70% of the requirements.

Title: Junior RAG Scientist | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_15) | Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Job Title: Junior RAG Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_15

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOSis seeking a talented Junior RAG Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Intelligent Systems group. In this role, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation, working on applied research projects that bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and real-world impact. You will contribute to initiatives that enhance industries, promote social well-being, and improve quality of life.

Your Role

  • Development and implementation of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Systems;
  • Create advanced RAG pipelines, semantically fusing technical documentation and logs;
  • Develop modules to manage complex documentation using advanced Large Language Models (LLMs).

Your Profile

Academic Qualifications:

  • Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent qualifications in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence or related studies.

Technical Skills

  • Programming proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow;
  • Experience or strong interest in Large Language Models and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

Other Skills

  • Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);
  • Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Interest in advancing AI solutions that maintain robust performance under diverse and challenging conditions;
  • Commitment to clear and honest communication of data and model limitations using established reporting standards and tools;
  • Interest in applied research;
  • Ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary and cross-functional teams;
  • Autonomous, dependable, proactive, and a critical-thinking team player.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected. The first evaluation of applications will occur on 28th of July 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in September 2025.

To Apply

Send your application to jobs@fraunhofer.pt including:

  • Curriculum Vitae (mandatory);
  • Motivation Letter;
  • Recommendation Letters (optional but welcome).

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • AI4CarOps ‚Äì AI-Powered Innovations for Car Workshop Operations, with Notice No. MPr-2023-07- SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o);
  • FIBFlow ‚Äì Financial Intelligent Business Flow, with Notice No. MPr-2023-08-SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o);
  • Microelectr√≥nica ‚Äì Agenda Microeletr√≥nica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. Projeto n¬∫ 19 NextGenerationEU (PRR).

Title: Data Science Co-Founder / CTO (100 % remote) (m/f/d)
Description:
We are looking to hire ambitious entrepreneurs to start and scale their own startups.




We are serial entrepreneurs, for example Paul M√ºller (founder Adjust, ‚Ç¨1.2B exit) and Petter Made (founder SumUp, ‚Ç¨8B) who are eager to support outlier personalities and serial entrepreneurs to build ‚Ç¨1B+ companies.




We offer:





A salary while you build your startup as you will directly be employed by us. Alternatively, you can opt for up to ‚Ç¨500k in funding.


Community: Access to the top 0.1% of founders, peers and investors


Personal Development: Weekly coaching with unicorn-founders


Funding: Support in securing a multi-million euro funding round within 12 months (on average, EWOR Fellows raise > ‚Ç¨2M after our Grand Pitch)


Talent: Hiring support through our network (over 50,000 professionals)


Distribution: Support in reaching product-market-fit and building up a sales force / marketing machine





Highlighting just one of many success stories, one of our fellows set a record for Europe‚Äôs largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a ‚Ç¨12M pre-seed investment.


Tasks



You will build, and run your own startup in fields such as Data Science


You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a fully customised programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management


You will receive support in hiring through our network to over 50,000 professionals and advice as well as best practices from serial entrepreneurs


You will receive coaching in making your startup ‚Äúinvestible‚Äù, i.e. ready to raise millions in funding


You will iterate your product with us until having reached product-market-fit and receive support in building up a sales force or creating a marketing empire respectively



Requirements



Based in Europe or the Americas or open to relocate


Willingness to take full responsibility for your own startup and scale it to ‚Ç¨100M+ in revenues


Excellent communication skills and English language





Join us and build a ‚Ç¨1B+ company with us!

  • Talent: Hiring support through our network (over 50,000 professionals)

  • Distribution: Support in reaching product-market-fit and building up a sales force / marketing machine


Highlighting just one of many success stories, one of our fellows set a record for Europe‚Äôs largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a ‚Ç¨12M pre-seed investment.


Tasks

  • You will build, and run your own startup in fields such as Data Science

  • You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a fully customised programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management

  • You will receive support in hiring through our network to over 50,000 professionals and advice as well as best practices from serial entrepreneurs

  • You will receive coaching in making your startup ‚Äúinvestible‚Äù, i.e. ready to raise millions in funding

  • You will iterate your product with us until having reached product-market-fit and receive support in building up a sales force or creating a marketing empire respectively


Requirements

  • Based in Europe or the Americas or open to relocate

  • Willingness to take full responsibility for your own startup and scale it to ‚Ç¨100M+ in revenues

  • Excellent communication skills and English language


Join us and build a ‚Ç¨1B+ company with us!

Title: Full Stack Developer (Python, React)
Description:
We are looking for a talented Full Stack Developer to join our dynamic team, someone who specializes in Python and has solid knowledge of React. Is that you?

If yes, join us at Mobiweb, a Software House & Nearshore from Porto, established in 2017. Our specialities are Web and Mobile App Development on native and cross-platform technologies. We develop in-house products, but also work with companies of all sizes and geographies, from start-ups like Moomenti (Switzerland / USA) to powerhouses of the Telco and Media sectors, such as Sky (UK).‚ÄØ

We believe only Happy People can deliver the best products, so Team Morale is front and centre for us.‚ÄØ

We also believe Sharing is Caring, especially when it comes to knowledge. We take in very experienced developers, but also fresh-out-of-school programmers, and we expect everyone to collaborate to reach the best outcomes, teaching and learning.

Our Ultimate Goal is to make a positive impact on people's lives and businesses by developing custom and innovative solutions for our clients.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

We are in the Work Hard, Play Hard business. Can you handle it?‚ÄØ

That‚Äôs all very nice, but what‚Äôs in it for you?‚ÄØ

üí∞ Competitive salary (gross + benefits*, based on experience)

üéÜ End of the year Bonus based on the company‚Äôs performance

üíª High-quality equipment (You get a Mac, and you get a Mac, everyone gets a Mac!)‚ÄØ

üéÇ Paid time off on your birthday‚ÄØ

üè• Health Insurance‚ÄØ


Monthly Benefits that you can spend on Technology, Childcare, Transportation, Health, etc.


Still not convinced. Well, here are a few more:‚ÄØ

üìñ This is an ever-evolving industry, so we promote Continuous Learning with free access to Udemy‚ÄØ

‚è∞ Are you an early riser or a night-owl? It doesn‚Äôt matter, the working hours are Flexible‚ÄØ

üèñÔ∏è Work from wherever you want in Portugal (although, we have a fantastic office üòé)‚ÄØ

‚úàÔ∏è If you like Travelling, we might get you an International Project‚ÄØ

üëï The mandatory dress code is ‚Äúwhatever you like‚Äù‚ÄØ

ü•≥ Monthly Get-Togethers and an Annual Big Event‚ÄØ

üë™ Family Comes First, no ifs or buts‚ÄØ

‚öΩ Foosball

Are you still reading? That‚Äôs interesting! Since you‚Äôre still here, we might as well tell you what you‚Äôll need to be considered for this position:‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ


You have 3+ years of professional IT experience
Proven experience with Python frameworks like Django, FastAPI or Flask
Solid knowledge of React, Redux, JavaScript, TypeScript
You have experience working with REST APIs and third-party libraries
You have good knowledge of English, both spoken and written


Got all of that covered? Great stuff! Now have a look into what you should know to be successful in this role:‚ÄØ


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar
Understand relational and non-relational databases
Are familiar with security protocols and best practices
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
Exposure to DevOps practices and automated deployments
Previous work in cloud environments like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
Knowledge of component-based front-end architecture and micro-frontends


If you got this far you are committed! We want to know you, apply today! üöÄ‚ÄØ

PS: Have a look into our office üëá

Note: As a potential candidate for this position, you understand and agree that the information provided in your job application, including your resume and cover letter, is strictly confidential. We assure you that this information will not be disclosed to your current employer or any third party without your written consent. By submitting your application, you affirm that all information is true and accurate to the best of your knowledge.

Title: Senior/Lead Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
It's more than a job

In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.

‚Äé

Join a highly innovative and agile team of data scientists, data engineers, and software developers based in Hamburg, Porto, and Wroc≈Çaw to shape the next generation of data-driven logistics. As a Senior/Lead Data Scientist in the corporate AI team, you will design and implement world-class AI solutions for automation, decision-making, and optimization using the latest technologies. We are looking for a candidate who combines deep expertise in AI and software development with a passion for solving domain-specific challenges.

How you create impact


Design and implement our AI solutions using state-of-the-art AI technologies.
Shape the entire lifecycle of AI applications ‚Äì from ideation and exploration to specification, architectural design, prototyping, production implementation and enterprise-wide integration.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to identify new opportunities.
Mentor more junior team members by sharing technical and domain expertise.
Uphold high engineering standards through code reviews and technical guidance.
Take an active role in project coordination and roadmap planning.


What we would like you to bring


Master‚Äôs or PhD degree in data science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, physics or a related field.
Two years of experience as a Senior Data Scientist or in an equivalent role.
Capability to envision and deliver end-to-end data-driven solutions.
Advanced hands-on experience in AI model development with strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks. Familiarity with large language models (LLMs), retrieval augmented generation (RAG) and agent-based systems is a plus.
Proficiency in Python with proven software architecture and development skills in enterprise environments.
Experience with data pipelines, workflow orchestration, APIs and databases. Practical experience with deployment, CI/CD pipelines and cloud platforms is a plus.
Experience mentoring team members and consulting with business stakeholders.
Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English paired with a collaborative mindset.


What's in it for you

Join Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs IT Hub in Porto or Wroc≈Çaw and make a real impact on the digital transformation of our logistics enterprise. Here, you will find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You‚Äôll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, we encourage you to apply ‚Äî your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

Who we are

Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.

As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.

We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

Title: Software Engineer I
Description:
At Talkdesk, we are courageous innovators focused on redefining the customer experience, making the impossible possible for companies globally. We champion an inclusive and diverse culture representative of the communities in which we live and serve. And, we give back to our community by volunteering our time, supporting non-profits, and minimizing our global footprint. Each day, thousands of employees, customers, and partners all over the world trust Talkdesk to deliver a better way to great experiences.




We are recognized as a cloud contact center leader by many of the most influential research organizations, including Gartner and Forrester. With $498 million in total funding, a valuation of more than $10 Billion, and a ranking of #16 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list, now is the time to be part of the Talkdesk legacy to help accelerate our success in a new decade of transformational growth.




At Talkdesk, we embrace FAST, our fundamental operating principles that define who we are as an organization. These principles drive us to make the impossible possible. FAST: Focus + Accountability + Speed = Talkdesker.





Focus: Focus time, energy and attention on what is most impactful for the business and thoughtful about how and when to partner with others.


Accountability: Hold self and others accountable to meet commitments and drive results. Accept responsibility for successes and failures.


Speed: Execute with agility and urgency. Act promptly, decisively, and without delay. Make good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.


Talkdesker: YOU!



The Software Engineer I is responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of software systems. The role requires an understanding of programming languages, software development frameworks, and database management. The successful candidate will work closely with a team of software developers, product managers, and quality assurance specialists to develop high-quality software solutions that meet client requirements.




Duties and Responsibilities:





Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify software requirements and design software solutions


Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code


Test and debug software applications


Troubleshoot software issues and provide timely resolutions


Maintain and update existing software systems


Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback


Provide technical support to end-users when required





Qualifications:





Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field


Proven experience in software development


Proficiency in programming languages such as Javascript, TypeScript and React


Knowledge in Java is a plus


Familiarity with software testing methodologies such as unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing


Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills


Ability to work in a team environment


Strong communication skills





¬†




Additional Notes:
This position will follow a hybrid work model.




Work Environment and Physical Requirements:




Primarily office-environment work, extended periods of sitting or standing, computer-based work. Limited lifting, and equipment usage limited to computer-related equipment (keyboards, mouse, etc.)


The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.
Show more

Title: Senior Scientist/Researcher ‚Äì Co2 Utilization Team
Description:
Senior Scientist/Researcher ‚Äì CO2 Utilization Team

Senior Scientist/Researcher ‚Äì CO2 Utilization Team

2 weeks ago Be among the first 25 applicants

CoLAB NET4CO2 is seeking a highly qualified Senior Engineer/Researcher to join our CO 2 Utilization team.

This team aims the development and assessment of effective technologies for the utilisation of the greenhouse gas carbon dioxide captured from large emission sources, such as industrial plants or/ and directly from air.

This field complements Carbon Capture technologies, and their integration can result in significant reductions in global CO 2 emissions.

Main Responsibilities


Support the synthetic fuels research line in the scope of CO2 utilization, involving, but not limited to the development of new technologies and process optimisation;
Engage inresearch activities related to carbon dioxide utilization, mainly concerning the proof of concept of prototypes for different fuels;
Engage inthe commercial plan and way forward steps;
Promote cooperation with external R&D and industrial stakeholders and identify possible synergies;
Prepare applications for competitive funding;
Support and guidance to PhD and master students;
Prepare technical-scientific reports;
Promote scientific dissemination.


Required Skills


PhD in Chemical Engineering or a related field;
At least five years of experience in a relevant field and respective relevant publications;
Knowledgeof carbon dioxide utilisation technologies towards synthetic fuels production (gas and liquid fuels);
Experience and motivation in laboratory procedures;
Proven track record with different reactor technologies/ prototypes at different scales;
Experience in materials screening, and characterization techniques, including gas chromatography;
Experience in supervising and coordinating the work of junior researchers;
Strong analytical skills and ability to solve complex problems with an out-of-the-box approach;
Knowledgein process simulation and optimisation using ASPEN Plus is valued;
Excellentcommunication skills with a strong team spirit, fully open to collaborate with other teams (internal or external to the organisation);
Foreign languages proficiency:


very good English level;


Valid working VISA to work in Portugal.


Other Personal Skills/ Soft Skills


Excellent writing and communication skills
Proactivity and ability to identify new opportunities and stakeholders
Strong team spirit
Open-mindedness
Availability for traveling
English level:


Very Good or advanced


Background with electrochemical processes will be considered an asset


Location:

based in Porto (Portugal)

We offer a challenging and rewarding work environment with a competitive compensation package.

Join us and help us build a sustainable future!

Please send your resume and cover letter to apply.

Title: Python Rockstar Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for bright Python Rockstar Developers to join our team




Join Critical TechWorks as a Python Developer and be part of our dynamic team driving the digital transformation in the automotive landscape for BMW Group's future driving machines. In this role, you'll be more than just a coder; you'll be a problem-solver, planner, and doer, bringing energy and star-quality to crafting high-quality, reliable software components for a variety of groundbreaking projects.




Framework Development: Engage in developing frameworks to facilitate integration testing for various communication protocols, ensuring seamless interactions within complex systems.
Automation and Testing: Craft and enhance automation frameworks for comprehensive testing, including hardware, software, and model-in-the-loop scenarios, to ensure robustness and reliability.
Scripting and Configuration: Regularly develop Python scripts for Linux environments, focusing on configuring the integration of a diverse range of tools within the CI/CD pipeline.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with other teams, including development, testing, and operations, to understand requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Quality and Reliability: Apply rigorous testing and quality assurance practices to maintain high standards in all software components, contributing to the overall reliability of the systems.
Innovative Solutions: Contribute to the development of innovative solutions in areas like framework development for integration testing, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of testing processes.




This is a Rockstar Developer role, our take on the classic Software Developer.

Standing as the brick-and-mortar of Critical TechWorks, it plays a crucial role in designing, developing, building, testing, deploying, and maintaining our product. You can find out more - and check other Development vacancies - at this link.




Whatever you‚Äôre working on, here‚Äôs the lowdown on the technical skills you‚Äôre likely to have:

Proven experience developing in Python.
Experience developing scripting for Linux.
Experience with other scripting languages (preferably Shell).
Experience with version control tools (preferably Git).




CTW's Daily Toolkit




Apart from great technical skills, our environment is fast-paced and 100% agile, and prioritizes autonomy, teamwork, interaction and resilience. This means our Python Developers must also possess the following:

Embrace agile and its implementation frameworks namely Scrum, to make the most out of all its events and work to keep evolving a high-performing team.
Be available to be a cross-functional team member by using and developing new skills and enabling a fully responsible team able to cover the whole product lifecycle.
Use standard software engineering practices and tools like version control, IDEs, data dashboards, to manage and keep a systematic and organized development process.
Use state of the art DevOps quality practices and tools such as Continuous Integration /Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to build, analyse, perform automated testing and deployment processes, to ensure a streamlined and reliable development workflow.
Run and operate developed software inside and outside working hours if needed, to provide high quality software services (extra compensation will be applicable).
Be available to travel abroad for short periods, as required to support all the phases of the product development cycle when needed.
Have excellent English oral and written skills. German communication skills will be a plus.




Who we are




Critical TechWorks seeks a distinct and treasured corporate culture, that is very much our own. This means:

Growth and Innovation: Be a key player in shaping the future of mobility through innovative ideas.
Engineering Excellence: Immerse yourself in an environment valuing engineering process, where we create, innovate, lead, and make a tangible impact.
Autonomy and Collaboration: Thrive in a culture that blends autonomy with teamwork, contributing to groundbreaking developments.
Continuous Learning: Embrace constant skill enhancement in a dynamic workplace, where your contributions impact cutting-edge technology projects.




Join Critical TechWorks on our journey of innovation, excellence, and redefining the future of motion, one product at a time.




At Critical Techworks we are creating an inclusive culture that values our people‚Äôs different viewpoints and experiences, regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, ethnicity, religion, or disability.

Title: Banking Sector | Python Developer
HTML:
Company Description
At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

  • Develop code as per the team‚Äôs specifications ‚Äì analyze, validate and review code;

  • Participate in coding sprints and continuous improvement;

  • Automation of security rules implementation;

  • Document the tool and operating mode, troubleshooting, etc.;

  • Perform tests.


Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience with of Django framework;

  • Experience in frontend development (Angular) is a plus;

  • Experienced in Agile methodology;

  • Experience using SDLC tools ‚Äì software orchestration / versioning tools, automation server, etc;

  • Good organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills;

  • Autonomous, while capable of working within a team;

  • Fluency in English.


Additional Information
The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Associate/Junior Test Engineer - OP01784
Description:
üü¢ At Dev.Pro, we work on projects that impact millions of people around the world ‚Äî but we know it's the people behind the tech who make it all happen. We truly value what makes each person unique and are building a workplace that's inclusive, friendly, and supportive.

We invite a motivated and detail-oriented Test Engineer to join our team. In this role, you'll support the development of a leading healthcare cost containment platform that offers affordable health insurance plans for self-insured employers, third-party administrators, commercial payers, and claim auditors. You'll focus on manual testing and data validation to ensure the accuracy and reliability of backend processes that power core components of the platform, including patient advocacy, analytics & reporting, and accredited care management services.

üü© What's in it for you:


Work on a stable, long-term healthcare project used by major U.S. payers and employers
Get hands-on experience testing real-world healthcare data and backend systems
Learn from experienced teammates eager to share their knowledge and support your growth


‚úÖ Is that you?


Up to 6 months of commercial manual testing experience
Basic understanding of software testing and data validation principles
Familiarity with manual testing techniques and test case execution
Ability to write basic SQL queries for data validation
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (sorting, filtering, conditional formatting)
Intermediate+ English level
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Good communication and teamwork abilities
Proactive mindset with a strong desire to learn and grow
High sense of ownership, accountability, and visibility in work


Desirable:


Basic knowledge of MS SQL Server
Experience with Redgate or similar tools
Basic knowledge of test management or defect-tracking tools
Working knowledge of Git


üß©Key responsibilities and your contribution

In this role, you'll perform manual testing and data validation to ensure the quality and reliability of systems that update regulatory data across multiple healthcare revenue cycle management products.


Perform manual testing of data loading, transformation, and validation processes
Verify the accuracy and completeness of data from various sources
Execute and document test cases based on business and technical requirements
Identify, report, and track defects related to data quality and processing
Collaborate with developers and data analysts to align on testing needs
Use tools like Microsoft Excel and SQL queries to validate and analyze data
Participate in team meetings and contribute to testing quality improvements


üéæ What's working at Dev.Pro like?

‚úîÔ∏è 30 paid days off per year ‚Äî take them whenever you want for vacation, holidays, or personal time

‚úîÔ∏è 5 paid sick days, up to 60 days of medical leave, and 6 paid days off per year for major family events like weddings, funerals, or the birth of a child

‚úîÔ∏è Partially covered health insurance after the probation, plus a wellness bonus for gym memberships, sports nutrition, and similar needs after 6 months

‚úîÔ∏è Grow your skills with English lessons, online training, conferences, and the option to explore new career paths

Our next steps:

‚úÖ Submit a CV in English ‚Äî ‚úÖ Intro call with a Recruiter ‚Äî ‚úÖ Interview ‚Äî ‚úÖ Offer

Interested? Find out more:

üìãHow we work

üíª LinkedIn Page

üìà Our website

üíªIG Page

Title: Software Engineer II (Data Platform)
Description:
We believe that we are better together, and at Tripadvisor we welcome you for who you are. Our workplace is for everyone, as is our people powered platform. At Tripadvisor, we want you to bring your unique perspective and experiences, so we can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.

At Tripadvisor, we host 450+ million monthly active visitors, and assist them to explore the world, and up-level their travel. Tripadvisor also has a culture of test and learn to encourage finding new ways to better serve travelers.

We are responsible for providing software that enables Tripadvisor to better understand visitor preferences in order to enable tailoring our site, app and product offerings to assist them in having more delightful travel experiences. We are also responsible for the software system that empowers Product Managers, General Managers, and Engineering to experiment and test out new innovative ideas across all Tripadvisor surfaces including the website, mobile app, and customer communications in email. These experiments in turn drive millions of dollars of revenue annually.

Tripadvisor is looking for a Software Engineer II to take this exciting opportunity to join our fast-moving data platform group. In this role, you will help us build, upgrade, and sustain large-scale data processing and successful tracking and experimentation infrastructure to serve the world‚Äôs largest and most trusted travel site, visited by over 450 million travelers each month, and the world‚Äôs leading travel brands, from large OTAs to independent boutique chains.

Do you like building features end to end? Do you like working with a large number of technologies? Do you like moving quickly, releasing features daily, and working with other smart and talented engineers? If this sounds like you, we‚Äôd love to talk to you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Take on projects with independence and a mandate to leave things better than you found them.
Participate in the planning and initial steps for key changes on the site.
Be pragmatic when solving problems with a deep understanding of the purpose and goal of your work.
Touch code at all levels, from client ingestion to data storage, data analysis whatever is required to complete your project. Take responsibility for all aspects of software engineering, from design to implementation, QA, and maintenance.
Have a CI/CD mindset. Most of our engineers release code to production every few days and we have a daily release cycle.
Be integral for the code quality on your team through leadership in design and code review. Take responsibility for the quality of the code produced by you and the team
Operate across our evolving technology stack - we‚Äôre developing in Java, React, SQL, and more.
Collaborate closely with Product and design teams to define feature specifications and develop high quality deliverables for our stakeholders.
Work alongside other engineering groups located around the world.


Skills & Qualifications


5+ years of experience in commercial software development
A strong history of development with Java.
Some exposure to the following technologies a plus: HTML5, JavaScript, React, GraphQL, CSS, SQL, Postgres, Linux, Python, Gradle, Apache Tomcat, BERT, Hive, Spark
Familiarity with Linux.
Familiarity with designing infrastructure on AWS or other cloud providers.
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
Solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and OO design.
Willingness and ability to take on new technologies.
Ability to break down complex problems into simple solutions.
Strong analytical skills and desire to write clean, correct, and efficient code.
Sense of ownership, urgency, and pride in your work.
Exposure to developing scalable code for high-volume systems is a plus.


Nice To Haves


Having a data mindset along with Software Engineering expertise. Also, have worked on designing infrastructures that deal with the processing of large data sets.
Experience working with and processing large quantities of data - Hive, Snowflake, NoSQL databases.


If you need a reasonable accommodation or support during the application or the recruiting process due to a medical condition or disability, please reach out to your individual recruiter or send an email to AccessibleRecruiting@Tripadvisor.com and let us know the nature of your request. Please include the job requisition number in your message.
